Pre-Game Insights: New Orleans has a trio of perimeter marksmen off to quality starts on their long-range attempts, but there’s been a major drop-off from there across the roster.
McCullum (13 of 34), Ingram (10 of 23) and Hawkins (9 of 18) are a combined 32 of 75 on threes, which is 43 percent, but the other Pelicans are just 11 of 45 (24 percent).
Yves Missi ranking among all NBA rookies in individual averages for scoring, rebounding and blocks.
Golden State players averaging at least 6.3 points per game during the club’s 3-1 start.
Reserves Lindy Waters and Jonathan Kuminga contributed 21 and 17 points, respectively, in Tuesday’s 18-point victory over New Orleans.
